variable.name: subid
variable.description: Child's project ID

variable.name: miss
variable.description: Misery - usual severity
variable.value: Transient misery, lasting less than 6 hours, easy to cheer up
Marked; lasting more than 6 hours or could only be cheered up with difficulty
Severe; could not be cheered up at all or was talking about a wish to die or run away or too miserable to engage in usual activities

variable.name: misf
variable.description: Misery - usual frequency
variable.value: No misery or less than once a week

variable.name: wors
variable.description: Worries - usual severity
variable.value: Mild or transient worrying, lasting less than 6 hours appropriate to the problem no interference with usual activities easy to reassure
Marked Lasting more than 6 hours or difficult to reassure or moderate interference with usual activities or out of proportion to the problem
Severe; could not be reassured or marked interference with usual activities e.g. loss of sleep, not going out etc.

variable.name: worf
variable.description: Worries - usual frequency
variable.value: No worries or less than once a week

variable.name: f1
variable.description: Fear of animals, insects, snakes

variable.name: f2
variable.description: Fear of objects that can cause injury (e.g. cars, knives, scissors)

variable.name: f3
variable.description: Fear of dirt, germs, contamination

variable.name: f4
variable.description: Fear of being away from home or attachment figures

variable.name: f5
variable.description: Fear of strangers, new situations

variable.name: f6
variable.description: Fear of the dark, going to bed

variable.name: f7
variable.description: Fear of school

variable.name: f8
variable.description: Fear of social situations (travel, shops, swimming pool, etc.)

variable.name: f9
variable.description: Fear of other (give details)

variable.name: feas
variable.description: Fear - usual severity
variable.value: Mild; involves worry or reluctance to approach only, minimal
Marked; avoids situation or expresses severe worry
Severe; total avoidance leading to handicap of normal life (e.g. not going out, not going to school) or panic or gross anxiety shown

variable.name: eats
variable.description: Eating problems - usual severity
variable.value: Mild; one symptom only, no interference with activities, no vomiting, no weight loss or excessive weight gain
Moderate; more than one symptom or some interference with activities, but no vomiting, no weight loss or excessive weight gain
Severe; many symptoms or marked interference with activities or vomiting, weight loss, excessive weight gain

variable.name: eatf
variable.description: Eating problems - usual frequency
variable.value: No eating problems or less than once a week

variable.name: sles
variable.description: Sleeping problems - usual severity
variable.value: Mild; little distress, no interference with daytime activities
Moderate; moderate distress or moderate interference with daytime activities
Severe; marked distress or marked interference with daytime activities

variable.name: slef
variable.description: Sleeping problems - usual frequency
variable.value: No sleep difficulties or less than once a week

variable.name: moos
variable.description: Mood changes - usual severity
variable.value: Transient mood change, lasting less than 6 hours, easy to cheer up/ engage in activity
Marked; lasting more than 6 hours or could only be cheered up/engaged with difficulty
Severe; could not be cheered up at all, no engagement even in normally pleasurable activities

variable.name: moof
variable.description: Mood changes - usual frequency
variable.value: No mood change or less than once a week

variable.name: eps
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - perceived severity
variable.value: No problem perceived, no parental concern

variable.name: eoage
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - age of onset

variable.name: epc
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - control
variable.value: Can almost always control behaviour/ can modify on most occasions
Sometimes has control over behaviour/ can often modify or stop
No control over behaviour/ cannot modify or stop

variable.name: epi
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - impact
variable.value: Impaired at times or minor impairment

variable.name: epa
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - abnormality

variable.name: epm
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - mother's coping
variable.value: Highly efficient, problems always or nearly always anticipated and avoided
Efficient, proven plans in place even though they may not work every time
Problems are not avoided but ineffective strategies have been replaced with more effective
Ineffective strategies only, but do not aggravate the problem
Lack of response to a problem (e.g. uninvolved), but not making it worse
Parental actions are making the problem worse or adding new problem
Parental actions lead to the problem getting out of hand

variable.name: epf
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - father's coping
variable.value: Highly efficient, problems always or nearly always anticipated and avoided
Efficient, proven plans in place even though they may not work every time
Problems are not avoided but ineffective strategies have been replaced with more effective
Ineffective strategies only, but do not aggravate the problem
Lack of response to a problem (e.g. uninvolved), but not making it worse
Parental actions are making the problem worse or adding new problem
Parental actions lead to the problem getting out of hand

variable.name: eppc
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - parental consistency
variable.value: Differences of opinion but not of style
Parents overrule, countermand, or argue openly

variable.name: esb
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - school behaviours

variable.name: epib
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's emotional pattern - interviewer's abnormality rating

variable.name: itva
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - watching TV - usual attention span - PACS section 2.1

variable.name: itvr
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - watching TV - usual restlessness - PACS section 2.1
variable.value: More than once every 15 minutes but less than once every five minutes
Once every five minutes or stays in place for less than five minutes

variable.name: itvf
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - watching TV - usual fidgeting - PACS section 2.1
variable.value: More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: itvt
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - watching TV - usual talkativeness - PACS section 2.1
variable.value: No talking or the occasional comment
Talked for less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: itvn
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - watching TV - usual noisiness - PACS section 2.1
variable.value: Noisy less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: irea
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - reading - usual attention span - PACS section 2.2

variable.name: irer
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - reading - usual restlessness - PACS section 2.2
variable.value: More than once every 15 minutes but less than once every five minutes
Once every five minutes or stays in place for less than five minutes

variable.name: iref
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - reading - usual fidgeting - PACS section 2.2
variable.value: More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: iret
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - reading - usual talkativeness - PACS section 2.2
variable.value: No talking or the occasional comment
Talked for less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: iren
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - reading - usual noisiness - PACS section 2.2
variable.value: Noisy less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: ispa
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - solitary play - usual attention span - PACS section 2.3

variable.name: ispr
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - solitary play - usual restlessness - PACS section 2.3
variable.value: More than once every 15 minutes but less than once every five minutes
Once every five minutes or stays in place for less than five minutes

variable.name: ispf
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - solitary play - usual fidgeting - PACS section 2.3
variable.value: More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: ispt
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - solitary play - usual talkativeness - PACS section 2.3
variable.value: No talking or the occasional comment
Talked for less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: ispn
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - solitary play - usual noisiness - PACS section 2.3
variable.value: Noisy less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: ijpa
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - joint play - usual attention span - PACS section 2.4

variable.name: ijpr
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - joint play - usual restlessness - PACS section 2.4
variable.value: More than once every 15 minutes but less than once every five minutes
Once every five minutes or stays in place for less than five minutes

variable.name: ijpt
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - joint play - usual talkativeness - PACS section 2.4
variable.value: No talking or the occasional comment
Talked for less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: ijpn
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - joint play - usual noisiness - PACS section 2.4
variable.value: Noisy less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: imtr
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - meal times - usual restlessness - PACS section 2.5
variable.value: More than once every 15 minutes but less than once every five minutes
Once every five minutes or stays in place for less than five minutes

variable.name: imtf
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - meal times - usual fidgeting - PACS section 2.5
variable.value: More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: imtt
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - meal times - usual talkativeness - PACS section 2.5
variable.value: No talking or the occasional comment
Talked for less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: imtn
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - meal times - usual noisiness - PACS section 2.5
variable.value: Noisy less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: istr
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - shopping trips - usual restlessness - PACS section 2.6
variable.value: More than once every 15 minutes but less than once every five minutes
Once every five minutes or stays in place for less than five minutes

variable.name: istt
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - shopping trips - usual talkativeness - PACS section 2.6
variable.value: No talking or the occasional comment
Talked for less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: istn
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - shopping trips - usual noisiness - PACS section 2.6
variable.value: Noisy less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: ifor
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - family outings - usual restlessness - PACS section 2.7
variable.value: More than once every 15 minutes but less than once every five minutes
Once every five minutes or stays in place for less than five minutes

variable.name: ifon
variable.description: Activity level and inattentive behaviour - family outings - usual noisiness - PACS section 2.7
variable.value: Noisy less than half the time
More than half the time but not throughout

variable.name: iimq
variable.description: Impulsivity - waiting turn in queue - PACS section 2.8
variable.value: Becomes impatient very quickly but can wait
Often ' butts in ' or goes before his turn

variable.name: iimf
variable.description: Impulsivity - waiting to be served food - PACS section 2.8
variable.value: Becomes impatient very quickly but can wait
Often ' butts in ' or goes before his/her turn

variable.name: iimg
variable.description: Impulsivity - waiting turn in a game - PACS section 2.8
variable.value: Becomes impatient very quickly but can wait
Often ' butts in ' or goes before his/her turn

variable.name: iimqq
variable.description: Impulsivity - waiting to finish asking a question - PACS section 2.8
variable.value: Waits until the question is completed
Is somewhat hasty but listens to the question first
Blurts out the answer before the question is completed

variable.name: iimt
variable.description: Impulsivity - interrupted the conversation or made unnecessary comments - PACS section 2.8
variable.value: Constant interrupting so as to make conversation impossible

variable.name: hps
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's hyperactivity/impulsivity - perceived severity - PACS section 2.9
variable.value: No problem perceived, no parental concern

variable.name: hoage
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's hyperactivity/impulsivity - age of onset - PACS section 2.9

variable.name: hpc
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's hyperactivity/impulsivity - control - PACS section 2.9
variable.value: Can almost always control behaviour/ can modify on most occasions
Sometimes has control over behaviour/ can often modify or stop
No control over behaviour/ cannot modify or stop

variable.name: hpi
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's hyperactivity/impulsivity - impact - PACS section 2.9
variable.value: Impaired at times or minor impairment

variable.name: hpa
variable.description: Parental perceptions of child's hyperactivity/impulsivity - abnormality - PACS section 2.9

variable.name: iiab
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour a- reluctant to begin structured task at home - PACS section 2.9a
variable.value: Eager, or at least co-operative at first
Somewhat reluctant at first but no further complaints when started
Strong initial resistance or continued to complain throughout the task
Strong continued resistance or complete avoidance of the task

variable.name: iiaa
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour a - paid attention to detail during structured task - PACS section 2.9a
variable.value: Made effort to get things right, but occasional lapses
No attention to detail at all, task unfinished or sloppily done

variable.name: iiam
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour a- made mistakes during structured task - PACS section 2.9a
variable.value: Understood the task but made 1 or 2 unnecessary mistakes
Failed to pay close attention resulting in repeated careless mistakes
Was so careless that the task could not be completed or had to be done again

variable.name: iiai
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour a- listened and understood instructions - PACS section 2.9a
variable.value: Did not seem to listen but showed by actions that he/she had heard the instructions and understood
Did not seem to listen and showed by actions that he/she had only partly understood the instructions
Showed a marked lack of attention to and clearly misunderstood instructions

variable.name: iia1
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour a- how well did he/she follow instructions - PACS section 2.9a
variable.value: Followed the most important instructions but failed to follow others
Failed to follow most instructions including the most important ones

variable.name: iia2
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour a- completed task - PACS section 2.9a
variable.value: Completed most of task but left unfinished
Gave up very quickly or had to be forced to complete task

variable.name: iiad
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour a- easily distracted from task - PACS section 2.9a
variable.value: Temporarily distracted but returned to task of their own accord
Had to be told to return to task or abandoned task

variable.name: iibb
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour b -reluctant to begin homework - PACS section 2.9b
variable.value: Eager, or at least co-operative at first
Somewhat reluctant at first but no further complaints when started
Strong initial resistance or continued to complain throughout the task
Strong continued resistance or complete avoidance of the task

variable.name: iiba
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour b -paid attention to detail - PACS section 2.9b
variable.value: Effort to get things right, but occasional lapses
No attention to detail at all, task unfinished or sloppily done

variable.name: iibm
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour b -made mistakes - PACS section 2.9b
variable.value: Understood the task but made 1 or 2 unnecessary mistakes
Failed to pay close attention resulting in repeated careless mistakes
Was so careless that the task could not be completed or had to be done again

variable.name: iibi
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour b -listened and understood instructions - PACS section 2.9b
variable.value: Did not seem to listen but showed by actions that he/she had heard the instructions and understood
Did not seem to listen and showed by actions that he/she had only partly understood the instructions
Showed a marked lack of attention to and clearly misunderstood instructions

variable.name: iib1
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour b -how well did he/she follow instructions - PACS section 2.9b
variable.value: Followed the most important instructions but failed to follow others
Failed to follow most instructions including the most important ones

variable.name: iib2
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour b -completed task - PACS section 2.9b
variable.value: Completed most of task but left unfinished
Gave up very quickly or had to be forced to complete task

variable.name: iibd
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour b -easily distracted from task - PACS section 2.9b
variable.value: Temporarily distracted but returned to task of their own accord
Had to be told to return to task or abandoned task

variable.name: iico
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour c -well organised - PACS section 2.9c
variable.value: Collects everything needed before starting a task
Frequently has to get things after a task has been started
Never thinks beforehand about what is needed for the task

variable.name: iicar
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour c -often looses things necessary for task - PACS section 2.9c
variable.value: Loses things occasionally but does not make a habit of it
Loses things frequently, materials scattered or carelessly handled

variable.name: iicf
variable.description: Inattentive behaviour c -often forgets things - PACS section 2.9c
variable.value: Forgetful occasionally but does not make a habit of it

variable.name: ips
variable.description: Parental perceptions of inattentiveness - perceived severity
variable.value: No problem perceived, no parental concern

variable.name: ioage
variable.description: Parental perceptions of inattentiveness - age of onset

variable.name: ipc
variable.description: Parental perceptions of inattentiveness - control
variable.value: Can almost always control behaviour/ can modify on most occasions
Sometimes has control over behaviour/ can often modify or stop
No control over behaviour/ cannot modify or stop

variable.name: ipi
variable.description: Parental perceptions of inattentiveness - impact
variable.value: Impaired at times or minor impairment

variable.name: ipa
variable.description: Parental perceptions of inattentiveness - abnormality

variable.name: ipm
variable.description: Coping and consistency for hyperactivity, impulsiveness and inattentiveness - mother's coping with activity level/inattentiveness
variable.value: Highly efficient, problems always or nearly always anticipated and avoided
Efficient, proven plans in place even though they may not work every time
Problems are not avoided but ineffective strategies have been replaced with more effective
Ineffective strategies only, but do not aggravate the problem
Lack of response to a problem (e.g. uninvolved), but not making it worse
Parental actions are making the problem worse or adding new problem
Parental actions lead to the problem getting out of hand

variable.name: ipf
variable.description: Coping and consistency for hyperactivity, impulsiveness and inattentiveness - father's coping with activity level/inattentiveness
variable.value: Highly efficient, problems always or nearly always anticipated and avoided
Efficient, proven plans in place even though they may not work every time
Problems are not avoided but ineffective strategies have been replaced with more effective
Ineffective strategies only, but do not aggravate the problem
Lack of response to a problem (e.g. uninvolved), but not making it worse
Parental actions are making the problem worse or adding new problem
Parental actions lead to the problem getting out of hand

variable.name: ippc
variable.description: Coping and consistency for hyperactivity, impulsiveness and inattentiveness - parental consistency activity level/inattentiveness
variable.value: Differences of opinion but not of style
Parents overrule, countermand, or argue openly

variable.name: isb
variable.description: Coping and consistency for hyperactivity, impulsiveness and inattentiveness - school behaviours

variable.name: ipib
variable.description: Coping and consistency for hyperactivity, impulsiveness and inattentiveness - interviewer's abnormality rating

variable.name: lies
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - telling lies PACS section 3.1 - usual severity
variable.value: Lies but does not persist when challenged

variable.name: lief
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - telling lies PACS section 3.1 - usual frequency
variable.value: Never lies or less than once a week

variable.name: stes
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - stealing PACS section 3.2 - usual severity
variable.value: Trivial items, trivial amounts of money
Large sums of money or steals from shops

variable.name: stef
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - stealing PACS section 3.2 - usual frequency
variable.value: Not at all or less than once a month
More than once a month but less than once a week

variable.name: dess
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - destructiveness PACS section 3.3 - usual severity
variable.value: Destroyed siblings' property or mild damage outside home
Serious damage (e.g. starts fires) either in or outside home

variable.name: desf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - destructiveness PACS section 3.3 - usual frequency
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: aggs
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - aggressiveness PACS section 3.4 - usual severity
variable.value: Only when threatened or lashes out if provoked
Attacks/hurts people, has to be restrained

variable.name: aggf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - aggressiveness PACS section 3.4 - usual frequency
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: a1
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - is a 'bully'

variable.name: a2
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - started fights

variable.name: a3
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - used weapon

variable.name: a4
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - was cruel to animals

variable.name: a5
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - was cruel to people

variable.name: a6
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - stayed out at night

variable.name: a7
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - tried to set fire to something

variable.name: a8
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - ran away from home

variable.name: a9
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - has broken into a building or car

variable.name: a10
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - truanted from school

variable.name: abog
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - threatened anyone with a gun

variable.name: abor
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - engaged in mugging, extortion, committed robbery

variable.name: abos
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - forced someone into sexual activity

variable.name: aboc
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - antisocial behaviour outside of home - conned anyone to obtain goods, money, favours

variable.name: lots
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - loss of temper 3.6 - usual severity
variable.value: Mild, shouts, waves arms, stamps feet
Severe, breaks things, kicks or hits people

variable.name: lotf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - loss of temper 3.6 - usual frequency
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: ruds
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - rudeness 3.7 - usual severity
variable.value: Cheeky, answers back, pulls faces without intensely negative attitude
Swears or verbally abuses parent or other adults

variable.name: rudf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - rudeness 3.7 - usual frequency
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: diss
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - disobedience 3.8 - usual severity
variable.value: Mild, tries to ignore request or stall
Severe, refuses leading to loss of temper or aggression

variable.name: disf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - disobedience 3.8 - usual frequency
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: obaf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - oppositional behaviour PACS section 3.9 - frequency of arguments with adults
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: obnf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - oppositional behaviour PACS section 3.9 - frequency of deliberately doing things to annoy people
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: obif
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - oppositional behaviour PACS section 3.9 - frequency of expressing touchiness, irritation or annoyance
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: obrf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - oppositional behaviour PACS section 3.9 - frequency of expressing anger or resentment
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: obsf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - oppositional behaviour PACS section 3.9 - frequency of expressing spitefulness
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: obbf
variable.description: Disruptive behaviour - oppositional behaviour PACS section 3.9 - frequency of blaming others
variable.value: Never or less than once a week
On one or two days a week
On three to six days a week

variable.name: dps
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - perceived severity
variable.value: No problem perceived, no parental concern

variable.name: doage
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - age of onset

variable.name: dpc
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - control
variable.value: Can almost always control behaviour/ can modify on most occasions
Sometimes has control over behaviour/ can often modify or stop
No control over behaviour/ cannot modify or stop

variable.name: dpi
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - impact
variable.value: Impaired at times or minor impairment

variable.name: dpa
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - abnormality

variable.name: dpm
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - Mother's coping
variable.value: Highly efficient, problems always or nearly always anticipated and avoided
Efficient, proven plans in place even though they may not work every time
Problems are not avoided but ineffective strategies have been replaced with more effective
Ineffective strategies only, but do not aggravate the problem
Lack of response to a problem (e.g. uninvolved), but not making it worse
Parental actions are making the problem worse or adding new problem
Parental actions lead to the problem getting out of hand

variable.name: dpf
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - Father's coping
variable.value: Highly efficient, problems always or nearly always anticipated and avoided
Efficient, proven plans in place even though they may not work every time
Problems are not avoided but ineffective strategies have been replaced with more effective
Ineffective strategies only, but do not aggravate the problem
Lack of response to a problem (e.g. uninvolved), but not making it worse
Parental actions are making the problem worse or adding new problem
Parental actions lead to the problem getting out of hand

variable.name: dppc
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - Parental consistency
variable.value: Differences of opinion but not of style
Parents overrule, countermand, or argue openly

variable.name: dsb
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - school behaviours (conduct)

variable.name: dpib
variable.description: Parental perceptions of disruptive behaviour - abnormality

variable.name: tis
variable.description: Severity of tics - PACS section 4
variable.value: No tics present with the above frequency
Single motor tics only, i.e. affecting 1 or 2 muscle groups only
Multiple motor tics, affecting 3 or more muscle groups
Vocal tics present, but motor tics are absent or single
Multiple motor and vocal tics both present

variable.name: tid
variable.description: Duration of tics - PACS section 4
variable.value: More than a year, though with tic-free periods of >3 months
More than a year, with no tic-free periods of >3 months

variable.name: tim
variable.description: Relationship to medication - PACS section 4
variable.value: Tics have only appeared during stimulant medication
At some time tics have been present in the absence of stimulant

variable.name: a14
variable.description: Problems in non-verbal communication - autism spectrum disorders - PACS section 4, age 4

variable.name: a1n
variable.description: Problems in non-verbal communication - autism spectrum disorders - PACS section 4, now

variable.name: a24
variable.description: Lack of relationships with peers - autism spectrum disorders - PACS section 4, age 4

variable.name: a2n
variable.description: Lack of relationships with peers - autism spectrum disorders - PACS section 4, now

variable.name: a34
variable.description: Lack of sharing of enjoyments/interests - autism spectrum disorders - PACS section 4, age 4

variable.name: a3n

variable.name: ac

variable.description: Attachment disorders: Ever been significantly neglected, physically abused or sexually molested

variable.name: aa
